snippet: Unlike previous demonstrations, dozens of people were reported arrested at a boisterous rally against the Kremlin on Sunday, including protest organizers.
abstract: Police and anti-government protesters clash outside the Kremlin walls, leaving 20 police officers injured, and dozens of protesters in jail; for Vladimir V Putin supporters, the violence seems to confirm suspicions that the anti-Putin protest movement that began in December is led by radical and would-be revolutionaries. Photos (M)0

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ; Glenn Kates and Anna Tikhomirova contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- The police and antigovernment protesters clashed just outside the Kremlin walls on Sunday, adding the images of flying bottles, smoke bombs and thumping nightsticks to those of Vladimir V. Putin's third inauguration as president. Sunday's demonstration, a day before the inauguration, drew at least 20,000 people, organizers and news outlets said. It began peacefully with a marching band and Muscovites waving placards lampooning Mr. Putin and his government. But the situation became chaotic when protesters tried to break through a column of riot police officers in an apparent effort to reach the Kremlin.

headline.main: Arrests and Violence at Overflowing Rally in Moscow
